answers.answer: I'm 35 weeks and i have no swollen feet , try not too walk or stand so much or eat things with salt drink lots and lots of water!!! And get foot massages those are the best (:
Have the doc check for preeclampsia mama. I just was diagnosed and,now I have to be induced at 36+4. The only symptom I had was swollen feet
Try soaking your feet in Epsom salt and warm water. That really helped me. And yes stay away from salt and drink lots of water, and also elevate your feet as much as you can.
I have ankle swelling but not feet. Me & my bf call them fswankles = fat swollen ankles lol
My husband gives me foot massage and I elevate my feet whenever possible  it helps so much! He'll also massage my calves and it does wonders. My feet would hurt so bad I couldn't even walk

question: I'm 34 weeks and my feet our finally swollen. Omg they hurt lol. I thought I would be fortunate not to get that, Haha. Wishful thinking. Any advice.
title: swollen feet
